articles.author: Gerry Doyle, Mike Stone
articles.description: The United States is amassing an arsenal of abundant and easily made anti-ship weapons as part of American efforts to deter China in the Indo-Pacific region and gear up U.S. forces there.
articles.title: US strategy for anti-ship weapons to counter China: plentiful, mobile, deadly
France uses tough, untested cybercrime law to target Telegram's Durov

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said that his government's first budget next month wouldn't take steps that undermine his goal to generate growth, but warned that unfunded spending commitments could damage the economy.
articles.title: UK PM Starmer says first budget won't undermine growth goal

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: Malnutrition is the world's worst child health crisis and climate change will only make things more severe, according to Microsoft-co-founder turned philanthropist Bill Gates.
articles.title: Climate change will escalate child health crisis due to malnutrition, says Gates

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The music mogul was arrested in Manhattan by federal agents based on a sealed indictment.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs arrested after grand jury indictment

articles.author: Katie Paul
articles.description: Facebook owner Meta said on Monday it was banning RT, Rossiya Segodnya and other Russian state media networks from its platforms, claiming the outlets had used deceptive tactics to carry out covert influence operations online.
articles.title: Meta bans RT and other Russian state media networks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The world's ozone layer is on "the road to long-term recovery" despite a destructive volcanic eruption in the South Pacific, the World Meteorological Organization said on Tuesday, after efforts to phase out ozone-depleting chemicals.
articles.title: Ozone layer on road to recovery despite volcano eruption, UN weather body says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces attacked energy infrastructure in Ukraine's northeastern Sumy region, cutting power in some districts and forcing authorities to resort to back-up power systems, local authorities said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia attacks energy infrastructure in Ukraine's Sumy region, local authorities say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian national residing in Sarasota, Florida, was arrested on Monday on charges of smuggling, money laundering and illegally exporting to Russia technology that could be used in drone production, the U.S. Department of Justice said.
articles.title: Russian national arrested in US for illegal export of drone technology to Russia, DOJ says

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: Less than two months ahead of the COP29 United Nations Climate Summit, the Azerbaijani leadership laid out its plans on Tuesday for what it hoped to achieve, as countries continue to wrestle with how to raise ambitions for a new financing target.
articles.title: COP29 leaders unveil climate funding and energy storage goals
